intro: Hedyotis auricularia var. brevipila, commonly known as the short-stemmed Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
